column2: Sky island by L Frank Baum. Chapter 9 THE TRIBULATION OF TROT. The apartments occupied by the Six Snubnosed Princesses were so magnificent that when Trot first entered them,
column3: Sky island by L Frank Baum. Chapter nine THE TRIBULATION OF TROT. The apartments occupied by the Six Snubnosed Princesses were so magnificent that when Trot first entered them,

column2: led by her haughty captors, she thought they must be the most beautiful rooms in the world.
column3: led by her haughty captors, she thought they must be the most beautiful rooms in the world.

column2: There was a long and broad reception room, with forty-seven windows in it, and opening out of it were six lovely bedchambers, each furnished in the greatest luxury.
column3: There was a long and broad reception room, with forty-seven windows in it, and opening out of it were six lovely bedchambers, each furnished in the greatest luxury.

column2: Adjoining each sleeping room was a marble bath, and each Princess had a separate boudoir and a dressing room. The furnishings were of the utmost splendor,
column3: Adjoining each sleeping room was a marble bath, and each Princess had a separate boudoir and a dressing room. The furnishings were of the utmost splendor,

column2: blue-gold and blue gems being profusely used in the decorations, while the divans and chairs were of richly carved bluewood upholstered in blue satins and silks.
column3: blue-gold and blue gems being profusely used in the decorations, while the divans and chairs were of richly carved bluewood upholstered in blue satins and silks.

column2: The draperies were superbly embroidered, and the rugs upon the marble floors were woven with beautiful scenes in every conceivable shade of blue.
column3: The draperies were superbly embroidered, and the rugs upon the marble floors were woven with beautiful scenes in every conceivable shade of blue.

column2: When they first reached the reception room, Princess Azure cast herself upon a divan while her five sisters sat or reclined in easy chairs with their heads thrown back and their blue chins scornfully elevated.
column3: When they first reached the reception room, Princess Azure cast herself upon a divan while her five sisters sat or reclined in easy chairs with their heads thrown back and their blue chins scornfully elevated.

column2: Trot, who was much annoyed at the treatment she had received, did not hesitate to seat herself also in a big easy chair.
column3: Trot, who was much annoyed at the treatment she had received, did not hesitate to seat herself also in a big easy chair.

column2: Slave! cried Princess Cerulia, Fetch me a mirror. Slave! cried Princess Turquoise, A lock of my hair is loosened; bind it up.
column3: Slave! cried Princess Cerulia, Fetch me a mirror. Slave! cried Princess Turquoise, A lock of my hair is loosened; bind it up.

column2: Slave! cried Princess Cobalt, Unfasten my shoes; they're too tight. Slave! cried Princess Sapphire, Bring hither my box of blue chocolates.
column3: Slave! cried Princess Cobalt, Unfasten my shoes; they're too tight. Slave! cried Princess Sapphire, Bring hither my box of blue chocolates.

column2: Slave! cried Princess Azure, Stand by my side and fan me. Slave! cried Princess Indigo, Get out of that chair. How dare you sit in our presence?
column3: Slave! cried Princess Azure, Stand by my side and fan me. Slave! cried Princess Indigo, Get out of that chair. How dare you sit in our presence?

column2: If you're saying all those things to me, replied Trot, you may as well save your breath.
column3: If you're saying all those things to me, replied Trot, you may as well save your breath.

column2: I'm no slave. And she cuddled down closer in the chair.
column3: I'm no slave. And she cuddled down closer in the chair.

column2: You ARE a slave! shouted the six all together.
column3: You ARE a slave! shouted the six all together.

column2: I'm not! Our father, the Revered and Resplendent Royal Ruler of the Blues, has made you our slave, asserted Indigo with a yawn.
column3: I'm not! Our father, the Revered and Resplendent Royal Ruler of the Blues, has made you our slave, asserted Indigo with a yawn.

column2: But he can't, objected the little girl. I'm some Royal and Rapturous and Ridic'lous myself, and I won't allow any cheap Boolooroo to order me 'round.
column3: But he can't, objected the little girl. I'm some Royal and Rapturous and Ridic'lous myself, and I won't allow any cheap Boolooroo to order me 'round.

column2: Are you of royal birth? asked Azure, seeming surprised.
column3: Are you of royal birth? asked Azure, seeming surprised.

column2: Royal! Why, I'm an American, Snubnoses, and if there's anything royaler than an American, I'd like to know what it is. The Princesses seemed uncertain what reply to make to this speech and began whispering together.
column3: Royal! Why, I'm an American, Snubnoses, and if there's anything royaler than an American, I'd like to know what it is. The Princesses seemed uncertain what reply to make to this speech and began whispering together.

column2: Finally, Indigo said to Trot, We do not think it matters what you were in your own country, for having left there you have forfeited your rank.
column3: Finally, Indigo said to Trot, We do not think it matters what you were in your own country, for having left there you have forfeited your rank.

column2: By recklessly intruding into our domain, you have become a slave, and being a slave you must obey us or suffer the consequences. What cons'quences? asked the girl.
column3: By recklessly intruding into our domain, you have become a slave, and being a slave you must obey us or suffer the consequences. What cons'quences? asked the girl.

column2: Dare to disobey us and you will quickly find out, snapped Indigo, swaying her head from side to side on its long, swan-like neck like the pendulum of a clock.
column3: Dare to disobey us and you will quickly find out, snapped Indigo, swaying her head from side to side on its long, swan-like neck like the pendulum of a clock.

column2: I don't want any trouble, said Trot gravely. We came to Sky Island by mistake and wanted to go right away again; but your father wouldn't let us.
column3: I don't want any trouble, said Trot gravely. We came to Sky Island by mistake and wanted to go right away again; but your father wouldn't let us.

column2: It isn't our fault we're still here, and I'm free to say you're a very dis'gree'ble and horrid lot of people with no manners to speak of, or you'd treat us nicely.
column3: It isn't our fault we're still here, and I'm free to say you're a very dis'gree'ble and horrid lot of people with no manners to speak of, or you'd treat us nicely.

column2: No impertinence! cried Indigo savagely.
column3: No impertinence! cried Indigo savagely.

column2: Why, it's the truth, replied Trot.
column3: Why, it's the truth, replied Trot.

column2: Indigo made a rush and caught Trot by both shoulders. The Princess was twice the little girl's size, and she shook her victim so violently that Trot's teeth rattled together.
column3: Indigo made a rush and caught Trot by both shoulders. The Princess was twice the little girl's size, and she shook her victim so violently that Trot's teeth rattled together.

column2: Then Princess Cobalt came up and slapped one side of the slave's face, and Princess Turquoise ran forward and slapped the other side.
column3: Then Princess Cobalt came up and slapped one side of the slave's face, and Princess Turquoise ran forward and slapped the other side.

column2: Cerulia gave Trot a push one way, and Sapphire pushed her the other way, so the little girl was quite out of breath and very angry when finally her punishment ceased.
column3: Cerulia gave Trot a push one way, and Sapphire pushed her the other way, so the little girl was quite out of breath and very angry when finally her punishment ceased.

column2: She had not been much hurt, though, and she was wise enough to understand that these Princesses were all cruel and vindictive, so that her safest plan was to pretend to obey them.
column3: She had not been much hurt, though, and she was wise enough to understand that these Princesses were all cruel and vindictive, so that her safest plan was to pretend to obey them.

column2: Now then, commanded Princess Indigo, go and feed my little blue dog that crows like a rooster. And feed my pretty blue cat that sings like a bird, said Princess Azure.
column3: Now then, commanded Princess Indigo, go and feed my little blue dog that crows like a rooster. And feed my pretty blue cat that sings like a bird, said Princess Azure.

column2: And feed my soft, blue lamb that chatters like a monkey, said Princess Cobalt.
column3: And feed my soft, blue lamb that chatters like a monkey, said Princess Cobalt.

column2: And feed my poetic blue parrot that barks like a dog, said Princess Sapphire.
column3: And feed my poetic blue parrot that barks like a dog, said Princess Sapphire.

column2: And feed my fuzzy blue rabbit that roars like a lion, said Princess Turquoise.
column3: And feed my fuzzy blue rabbit that roars like a lion, said Princess Turquoise.

column2: And feed my lovely blue peacock that mews like a cat, said Princess Cerulia.
column3: And feed my lovely blue peacock that mews like a cat, said Princess Cerulia.

column2: Anything else? asked Trot, drawing a long breath.
column3: Anything else? asked Trot, drawing a long breath.

column2: Not until you have properly fed our pets, replied Azure with a scowl.
column3: Not until you have properly fed our pets, replied Azure with a scowl.

column2: What do they eat, then? Meat! Milk! Clover! Seeds! Bread! Carrots! All right, said Trot, where do you keep the menagerie? Our pets are in our boudoirs, said Indigo harshly.
column3: What do they eat, then? Meat! Milk! Clover! Seeds! Bread! Carrots! All right, said Trot, where do you keep the menagerie? Our pets are in our boudoirs, said Indigo harshly.

column2: What a little fool you are! Perhaps, said Trot, pausing as she was about to leave the room, when I grow up I'll be as big a fool as any of you.
column3: What a little fool you are! Perhaps, said Trot, pausing as she was about to leave the room, when I grow up I'll be as big a fool as any of you.

column2: Then she ran away to escape another shaking, and in the first boudoir she found the little blue dog curled up on a blue cushion in a corner.
column3: Then she ran away to escape another shaking, and in the first boudoir she found the little blue dog curled up on a blue cushion in a corner.

column2: Trot patted his head gently, and this surprised the dog, who was accustomed to cuffs and kicks. So he licked Trot's hand and wagged his funny little tail and then straightened up and crowed like a rooster.
column3: Trot patted his head gently, and this surprised the dog, who was accustomed to cuffs and kicks. So he licked Trot's hand and wagged his funny little tail and then straightened up and crowed like a rooster.

column2: The girl was delighted with the queer doggie, and she found some meat in a cupboard and fed him out of her hand, patting the tiny creature and stroking his soft blue hair.
column3: The girl was delighted with the queer doggie, and she found some meat in a cupboard and fed him out of her hand, patting the tiny creature and stroking his soft blue hair.

column2: The doggie had never in his life known anyone so kind and gentle, so when Trot went into the next boudoir, the animal followed close at her heels, wagging his tail every minute.
column3: The doggie had never in his life known anyone so kind and gentle, so when Trot went into the next boudoir, the animal followed close at her heels, wagging his tail every minute.

column2: The blue cat was asleep on a window seat, but it woke up when Trot tenderly took it in her lap and fed it milk from a blue-gold dish.
column3: The blue cat was asleep on a window seat, but it woke up when Trot tenderly took it in her lap and fed it milk from a blue-gold dish.

column2: It was a pretty cat and instantly knew the little girl was a friend vastly different from its own bad-tempered mistress, so it sang beautifully as a bird sings,
column3: It was a pretty cat and instantly knew the little girl was a friend vastly different from its own bad-tempered mistress, so it sang beautifully as a bird sings,

column2: and both the cat and the dog followed Trot into the third boudoir.
column3: and both the cat and the dog followed Trot into the third boudoir.

column2: Here was a tiny baby lamb with fleece as blue as a larkspur and as soft as milk.
column3: Here was a tiny baby lamb with fleece as blue as a larkspur and as soft as milk.

column2: Oh, you darling! cried Trot, hugging the little lamb tight in her arms. At once the lamb began chattering just as a monkey chatters, only in the most friendly and grateful way,
column3: Oh, you darling! cried Trot, hugging the little lamb tight in her arms. At once the lamb began chattering just as a monkey chatters, only in the most friendly and grateful way,

column2: and Trot fed it a handful of fresh blue clover and smoothed and petted it until the lamb was eager to follow her wherever she might go.
column3: and Trot fed it a handful of fresh blue clover and smoothed and petted it until the lamb was eager to follow her wherever she might go.

column2: When she came to the fourth boudoir, a handsome blue parrot sat on a blue perch and began barking as if it were nearly starved.
column3: When she came to the fourth boudoir, a handsome blue parrot sat on a blue perch and began barking as if it were nearly starved.

column2: Then it cried out, Rub-a-dub, dub, Gimme some grub! Trot laughed and gave it some seeds, and while the parrot ate them she stroked gently his soft feathers.
column3: Then it cried out, Rub-a-dub, dub, Gimme some grub! Trot laughed and gave it some seeds, and while the parrot ate them she stroked gently his soft feathers.

column2: The bird seemed much astonished at the unusual caress and turned upon the girl first one little eye and then the other as if trying to discover why she was so kind.
column3: The bird seemed much astonished at the unusual caress and turned upon the girl first one little eye and then the other as if trying to discover why she was so kind.

column2: He had never experienced kind treatment in all his life. So it was no wonder that when the little girl entered the fifth boudoir she was followed by the parrot,
column3: He had never experienced kind treatment in all his life. So it was no wonder that when the little girl entered the fifth boudoir she was followed by the parrot,

column2: the lamb, the cat and the dog, who all stood beside her and watched her feed the peacock, which she found strutting around and mewing like a cat for his dinner.
column3: the lamb, the cat and the dog, who all stood beside her and watched her feed the peacock, which she found strutting around and mewing like a cat for his dinner.

column2: Said the parrot, I spy a peacock's eye On every feather. I wonder why? The peacock soon came to love Trot as much as the other bird and all the beasts did,
column3: Said the parrot, I spy a peacock's eye On every feather. I wonder why? The peacock soon came to love Trot as much as the other bird and all the beasts did,

column2: and it spread its tail and strutted after her into the next boudoir, the sixth one.
column3: and it spread its tail and strutted after her into the next boudoir, the sixth one.

column2: As she entered this room, Trot gave a start of fear, for a terrible roar like the roar of a lion greeted her.
column3: As she entered this room, Trot gave a start of fear, for a terrible roar like the roar of a lion greeted her.

column2: But there was no lion there; a fuzzy, blue rabbit was making all the noise. For goodness sake keep quiet, said Trot. Here's a nice blue carrot for you.
column3: But there was no lion there; a fuzzy, blue rabbit was making all the noise. For goodness sake keep quiet, said Trot. Here's a nice blue carrot for you.

column2: The color seems all wrong, but it may taste jus' as good as if it was red. Evidently it did taste good, for the rabbit ate it greedily.
column3: The color seems all wrong, but it may taste jus' as good as if it was red. Evidently it did taste good, for the rabbit ate it greedily.

column2: When it was not roaring, the creature was so soft and fluffy that Trot played with it and fondled it a long time after it had finished eating,
column3: When it was not roaring, the creature was so soft and fluffy that Trot played with it and fondled it a long time after it had finished eating,

column2: and the rabbit played with the cat and the dog and the lamb and did not seem a bit afraid of the parrot or the peacock.
column3: and the rabbit played with the cat and the dog and the lamb and did not seem a bit afraid of the parrot or the peacock.

column2: But all of a sudden in pounced Princess Indigo with a yell of anger.
column3: But all of a sudden in pounced Princess Indigo with a yell of anger.

column2: So this is how you waste your time, is it? exclaimed the Princess, and grabbing Trot's arm, she jerked the girl to her feet and began pushing her from the room.
column3: So this is how you waste your time, is it? exclaimed the Princess, and grabbing Trot's arm, she jerked the girl to her feet and began pushing her from the room.

column2: All the pets began to follow her, and seeing this, Indigo yelled at them to keep back. As they paid no attention to this command, the princess seized a basin of water and dashed the fluid over the beasts and birds,
column3: All the pets began to follow her, and seeing this, Indigo yelled at them to keep back. As they paid no attention to this command, the princess seized a basin of water and dashed the fluid over the beasts and birds,

column2: after which she renewed her attempt to push Trot from the room.
column3: after which she renewed her attempt to push Trot from the room.

column2: The pets rebelled at such treatment, and believing they ought to protect Trot, whom they knew to be their friend, they proceeded to defend her.
column3: The pets rebelled at such treatment, and believing they ought to protect Trot, whom they knew to be their friend, they proceeded to defend her.

column2: The little blue dog dashed at Indigo and bit her right ankle, while the blue cat scratched her left leg with its claws and the parrot flew upon her shoulder and pecked her ear.
column3: The little blue dog dashed at Indigo and bit her right ankle, while the blue cat scratched her left leg with its claws and the parrot flew upon her shoulder and pecked her ear.

column2: The lamb ran up and butted Indigo so that she stumbled forward on her face, when the peacock proceeded to pound her head with his wings.
column3: The lamb ran up and butted Indigo so that she stumbled forward on her face, when the peacock proceeded to pound her head with his wings.

column2: Indigo, screaming with fright, sprang to her feet again, but the rabbit ran between her legs and tripped her up, all the time roaring loudly like a lion,
column3: Indigo, screaming with fright, sprang to her feet again, but the rabbit ran between her legs and tripped her up, all the time roaring loudly like a lion,

column2: and the dog crowed triumphantly, as a rooster crows, while the cat warbled noisily and the lamb chattered and the parrot barked and the peacock screeched me-ow!
column3: and the dog crowed triumphantly, as a rooster crows, while the cat warbled noisily and the lamb chattered and the parrot barked and the peacock screeched me-ow!

column2: Altogether, Indigo was, as Trot said, scared stiff, and she howled for help until her sisters ran in and rescued her, pulling her through the bedchamber into the reception room.
column3: Altogether, Indigo was, as Trot said, scared stiff, and she howled for help until her sisters ran in and rescued her, pulling her through the bedchamber into the reception room.

column2: When she was alone, Trot sat down on the floor and laughed until the tears came to her eyes, and she hugged all the pets and kissed them every one and thanked them for protecting her.
column3: When she was alone, Trot sat down on the floor and laughed until the tears came to her eyes, and she hugged all the pets and kissed them every one and thanked them for protecting her.

column2: That's all right; We like a fight, declared the parrot in reply.
column3: That's all right; We like a fight, declared the parrot in reply.

column3: The Princesses were horrified to find Indigo so scratched and bitten, and they were likewise amazed at the rebellion of their six pets, which they had never petted,

column2: indeed, but kept in their boudoirs so they could abuse them whenever they felt especially wicked or ill-natured.
column3: indeed, but kept in their boudoirs so they could abuse them whenever they felt especially wicked or ill-natured.

column2: None of the snubnosed ones dared enter the room where the girl was, but they called through a crack in the door for Trot to come out instantly.
column3: None of the snubnosed ones dared enter the room where the girl was, but they called through a crack in the door for Trot to come out instantly.

column2: Trot, pretending not to hear, paid no attention to these demands.
column3: Trot, pretending not to hear, paid no attention to these demands.

column2: Finding themselves helpless and balked of their revenge, the Six Snubnosed Princesses finally recovered from their excitement and settled down to a pleasant sisterly quarrel,
column3: Finding themselves helpless and balked of their revenge, the Six Snubnosed Princesses finally recovered from their excitement and settled down to a pleasant sisterly quarrel,

column2: as was their customary amusement.

column2: Indigo wanted to have Trot patched, and Cerulia wanted her beaten with knotted cords, and Cobalt wanted her locked up in a dark room, and Sapphire wanted her fed on sand,

column2: Who has stolen my golden Key? And then there followed shouts of soldiers and guards and servants, and the rapid pattering of feet was heard throughout the palace.

column2: Sky island by L Frank Baum. Chapter 13 THE PINK COUNTRY. When the travelers could collect their senses and sit up, they stared about them in bewilderment,

column2: for the transition from the sticky, damp fog to this brilliant scene was so abrupt as to daze them at first.
column3: for the transition from the sticky, damp fog to this brilliant scene was so abrupt as to daze them at first.

column2: It was a Pink Country indeed. The grass was a soft pink, the trees were pink, all the fences and buildings which they saw in the near distance were pink even the gravel in the pretty paths was pink.
column3: It was a Pink Country indeed. The grass was a soft pink, the trees were pink, all the fences and buildings which they saw in the near distance were pink even the gravel in the pretty paths was pink.

column2: Many shades of color were there, of course, grading from a faint blush rose to deep pink verging on red, but no other color was visible.
column3: Many shades of color were there, of course, grading from a faint blush rose to deep pink verging on red, but no other color was visible.

column2: In the sky hung a pink glow, with rosy clouds floating here and there, and the sun was not silvery white, as we see it from the Earth, but a distinct pink.
column3: In the sky hung a pink glow, with rosy clouds floating here and there, and the sun was not silvery white, as we see it from the Earth, but a distinct pink.

column2: The sun was high in the sky just now, which proved the adventurers had been a long time in passing through the Fog Bank. But all of them were wonderfully relieved to reach this beautiful country in safety,
column3: The sun was high in the sky just now, which proved the adventurers had been a long time in passing through the Fog Bank. But all of them were wonderfully relieved to reach this beautiful country in safety,

column2: for aside from the danger that threatened them in the Blue Country, the other side of the island was very depressing. Here the scene that confronted them was pretty and homelike,
column3: for aside from the danger that threatened them in the Blue Country, the other side of the island was very depressing. Here the scene that confronted them was pretty and homelike,

column2: except for the prevailing color and the fact that all the buildings were round, without a single corner or angle.
column3: except for the prevailing color and the fact that all the buildings were round, without a single corner or angle.

column2: Half a mile distant was a large City, its pink tintings glistening bravely in the pink sunshine, while hundreds of pink banners floated from its numerous domes.
column3: Half a mile distant was a large City, its pink tintings glistening bravely in the pink sunshine, while hundreds of pink banners floated from its numerous domes.

column2: The country between the Fog Bank and the city was like a vast garden, very carefully kept and as neat as wax.
column3: The country between the Fog Bank and the city was like a vast garden, very carefully kept and as neat as wax.

column2: but as they sat upon the pink grass they felt the rays of the sun sending them warmth and rapidly drying their clothes; so, being tired out, they laid themselves comfortably down and first one and then another fell cozily asleep.
column3: but as they sat upon the pink grass they felt the rays of the sun sending them warmth and rapidly drying their clothes; so, being tired out, they laid themselves comfortably down and first one and then another fell cozily asleep.

column2: Advancing toward them were four of the natives of the Pink Country.

column3: They all had short necks and legs, pink hair and eyes, rosy cheeks and pink complexions, and their faces were good-natured and jolly in expression.

column2: It isn't just one country, but a good many countries. We have three countries in Sky Island, returned the woman. They are the Blue Country, the Fog Country and the Pink Country.

column2: Your story is the strangest we have ever heard, said she, and your presence here is still more strange and astonishing. So we have decided to take you to Tourmaline and let her decide what shall be your fate.
column3: Your story is the strangest we have ever heard, said she, and your presence here is still more strange and astonishing. So we have decided to take you to Tourmaline and let her decide what shall be your fate.

column3: Who is Tourmaline? inquired Trot doubtfully, for she didn't like the idea of being taken to anyone.

column2: The Queen of the Pinkies. She is the sole Ruler of our country, so the word of Tourmaline is the Law of the Land. Seems to me we've had 'bout enough of kings and queens, remarked captain Bill.
column3: The Queen of the Pinkies. She is the sole Ruler of our country, so the word of Tourmaline is the Law of the Land. Seems to me we've had 'bout enough of kings and queens, remarked captain Bill.

column2: Are you a giant? she asked the sailor in a soft, sweet voice.
column3: Are you a giant? she asked the sailor in a soft, sweet voice.

column2: No, your Majesty, he replied, I'm only Majesty! she exclaimed, flushing a deeper pink. Are you addressing that word to me? of course, ma'am, answered captain Bill.
column3: No, your Majesty, he replied, I'm only Majesty! she exclaimed, flushing a deeper pink. Are you addressing that word to me? of course, ma'am, answered captain Bill.

column2: I'm told that's the proper way to speak to a Queen. Perhaps you are trying to ridicule me, she continued, regarding the sailor's face closely.
column3: I'm told that's the proper way to speak to a Queen. Perhaps you are trying to ridicule me, she continued, regarding the sailor's face closely.

column2: There is nothing majestic about me, as you know very well. Coralie, do you consider 'majesty' a proper word to use when addressing a Queen? she added,
column3: There is nothing majestic about me, as you know very well. Coralie, do you consider 'majesty' a proper word to use when addressing a Queen? she added,

column2: appealing to the Pinky woman.
column3: appealing to the Pinky woman.

column2: By no means, was the prompt reply.
column3: By no means, was the prompt reply.

column2: What shall I call her, then? inquired captain Bill.
column3: What shall I call her, then? inquired captain Bill.

column2: Just Tourmaline. That is her name, and it is sufficient, said the woman.
column3: Just Tourmaline. That is her name, and it is sufficient, said the woman.

column2: The Ruler of a country ought to be treated with great respec', declared Trot a little indignantly, for she thought the pretty little queen was not being properly deferred to.
column3: The Ruler of a country ought to be treated with great respec', declared Trot a little indignantly, for she thought the pretty little queen was not being properly deferred to.

column2: Why? asked Tourmaline curiously.
column3: Why? asked Tourmaline curiously.

column2: Because the Ruler is the mos' 'risticratic person in any land, explained the little girl. Even in America ever'body bows low to our President,
column3: Because the Ruler is the mos' 'risticratic person in any land, explained the little girl. Even in America ever'body bows low to our President,

column2: and the Blueskins are so 'fraid of their Boolooroo that they tremble whenever they go near him.
column3: and the Blueskins are so 'fraid of their Boolooroo that they tremble whenever they go near him.

column2: But surely that is all wrong, said Tourmaline gravely. The Ruler is appointed to protect and serve the people, and here in the Pink Country I have the full power to carry out the laws.
column3: But surely that is all wrong, said Tourmaline gravely. The Ruler is appointed to protect and serve the people, and here in the Pink Country I have the full power to carry out the laws.

column2: I even decree death when such a punishment is merited. Therefore I am a mere agent to direct the laws,
column3: I even decree death when such a punishment is merited. Therefore I am a mere agent to direct the laws,

column2: which are the Will of the People, and am only a public servant obliged constantly to guard the welfare of my subjects.
column3: which are the Will of the People, and am only a public servant obliged constantly to guard the welfare of my subjects.

column2: In that case, said Button-Bright, you're entitled to the best there is to pay for your trouble. A powerful ruler ought to be rich and to live in a splendid palace.
column3: In that case, said Button-Bright, you're entitled to the best there is to pay for your trouble. A powerful ruler ought to be rich and to live in a splendid palace.

column2: Your folks ought to treat you with great respect, as Trot says. Oh no, responded Tourmaline quickly. That would indeed be very wrong.
column3: Your folks ought to treat you with great respect, as Trot says. Oh no, responded Tourmaline quickly. That would indeed be very wrong.

column2: Too much should never be given to anyone. If, with my great power, conferred upon me by the people, I also possessed great wealth, I might be tempted to be cruel and overbearing.
column3: Too much should never be given to anyone. If, with my great power, conferred upon me by the people, I also possessed great wealth, I might be tempted to be cruel and overbearing.

column2: In that case my subjects would justly grow envious of my superior station. If I lived as luxuriously as my people do and had servants and costly gowns,
column3: In that case my subjects would justly grow envious of my superior station. If I lived as luxuriously as my people do and had servants and costly gowns,

column2: the good Pinkies would say that their Queen had more than they themselves, and it would be true.
column3: the good Pinkies would say that their Queen had more than they themselves, and it would be true.

column2: No, our way is best. The Ruler, be it king or queen, has absolute power to rule, but no riches, no high station, no false adulation.
column3: No, our way is best. The Ruler, be it king or queen, has absolute power to rule, but no riches, no high station, no false adulation.

column2: The people have the wealth and honor, for it is their due. The Queen has nothing but the power to execute the laws, to adjust grievances and to compel order.
column3: The people have the wealth and honor, for it is their due. The Queen has nothing but the power to execute the laws, to adjust grievances and to compel order.

column2: What pays you, then, for all your bother? asked Trot.
column3: What pays you, then, for all your bother? asked Trot.

column2: I have one great privilege. After my death a pink marble statue of me will be set up in the Grand Court, with the statues of the other Kings and Queens who have ruled this land,
column3: I have one great privilege. After my death a pink marble statue of me will be set up in the Grand Court, with the statues of the other Kings and Queens who have ruled this land,

column2: and all the Pinkies in ages to come will then honor me as having been a just and upright queen.
column3: and all the Pinkies in ages to come will then honor me as having been a just and upright queen.

column2: That is my reward. I'm sorry for you, ma'am, said captain Bill. Your pay for bein' a queen is sort of like a life-insurance.
column3: That is my reward. I'm sorry for you, ma'am, said captain Bill. Your pay for bein' a queen is sort of like a life-insurance.

column2: If don't come due till after you're dead, and then you can't get much fun out of it. I did not choose to be the Queen, answered Tourmaline simply.
column3: If don't come due till after you're dead, and then you can't get much fun out of it. I did not choose to be the Queen, answered Tourmaline simply.

column2: A misfortune of birth placed me here, and I cannot escape my fate. It is much more desirable to be a private citizen, happy and carefree.
column3: A misfortune of birth placed me here, and I cannot escape my fate. It is much more desirable to be a private citizen, happy and carefree.

column2: But we have talked long enough of myself. Tell me who you are, and why you have come here. Between them they told the story of how the Magic Umbrella had taken them to Sky Island,
column3: But we have talked long enough of myself. Tell me who you are, and why you have come here. Between them they told the story of how the Magic Umbrella had taken them to Sky Island,

column2: which they did not know when they started was anywhere in existence.
column3: which they did not know when they started was anywhere in existence.

column2: Button-Bright told this, and then Trot related their adventures among the Blueskins and how the Boolooroo had stolen the umbrella and prevented them from going home again.
column3: Button-Bright told this, and then Trot related their adventures among the Blueskins and how the Boolooroo had stolen the umbrella and prevented them from going home again.

column2: The parrot on her shoulder kept interrupting her continually, for the mention of the Boolooroo seemed to make the bird frantic with rage.
column3: The parrot on her shoulder kept interrupting her continually, for the mention of the Boolooroo seemed to make the bird frantic with rage.

column2: Naughty, naughty Boolooroo!
column3: Naughty, naughty Boolooroo!

column2: He's the worst I ever knew! the parrot repeated over and over again.
column3: He's the worst I ever knew! the parrot repeated over and over again.

column2: captain Bill finished the story by telling of their escape through the Fog Bank. We didn't know what your Pink Country was like, of course, he said,
column3: captain Bill finished the story by telling of their escape through the Fog Bank. We didn't know what your Pink Country was like, of course, he said,

column2: but we knew it couldn't be worse than the Blue Country, an' we didn't take any stock in their stories that the Fog Bank would be the death of us.
column3: but we knew it couldn't be worse than the Blue Country, an' we didn't take any stock in their stories that the Fog Bank would be the death of us.

column2: Pretty wet! Pretty wet Was the journey, you can bet! declared the parrot in conclusion.
column3: Pretty wet! Pretty wet Was the journey, you can bet! declared the parrot in conclusion.

column2: Yes, it was wet and sticky, all right, agreed the sailor, but the big frog helped us and we got through all right. But what can you do here? asked Tourmaline.
column3: Yes, it was wet and sticky, all right, agreed the sailor, but the big frog helped us and we got through all right. But what can you do here? asked Tourmaline.

column2: You are not like my people, the Pinkies, and there is no place for you in our country. That's true enough, said captain Bill, but we had to go somewhere,
column3: You are not like my people, the Pinkies, and there is no place for you in our country. That's true enough, said captain Bill, but we had to go somewhere,

column2: an' this was the likeliest place we could think of.
column3: an' this was the likeliest place we could think of.

column2: Your Sky Island ain't very big, so when we couldn't stay in the Blue Country, where ever'body hated us, or in the Fog Bank, which ain't healthy and is too wet for humans to live in for long,
column3: Your Sky Island ain't very big, so when we couldn't stay in the Blue Country, where ever'body hated us, or in the Fog Bank, which ain't healthy and is too wet for humans to live in for long,

column2: we nat'rally were forced to enter the Pink Country, where we expected to find nice people. We ARE nice, said Tourmaline, but it is our country,
column3: we nat'rally were forced to enter the Pink Country, where we expected to find nice people. We ARE nice, said Tourmaline, but it is our country,

column2: not yours, and we have no place here for strangers.
column3: not yours, and we have no place here for strangers.

column2: In all our history you are the first people from outside our borders who have ever stepped a foot in our land. We do not hate you, as you say the Blueskins do,
column3: In all our history you are the first people from outside our borders who have ever stepped a foot in our land. We do not hate you, as you say the Blueskins do,

column2: nor are we savage or cruel, but we do not want you here, and I am really puzzled what to do with you.
column3: nor are we savage or cruel, but we do not want you here, and I am really puzzled what to do with you.

column2: Isn't there a law to cover this case? asked Coralie.
column3: Isn't there a law to cover this case? asked Coralie.

column2: I do not remember any such law, replied the queen, but I will search in the Great Book and see if I can find anything that refers to strange people entering our land.
column3: I do not remember any such law, replied the queen, but I will search in the Great Book and see if I can find anything that refers to strange people entering our land.

column2: If not, said the woman, you must make a law. It is your duty. I know, answered Tourmaline, but I hope such a responsibility will not fall upon my shoulders.
column3: If not, said the woman, you must make a law. It is your duty. I know, answered Tourmaline, but I hope such a responsibility will not fall upon my shoulders.

column2: These poor strangers are in a very uncomfortable position, and I wish I could help them to get back to their own country.
column3: These poor strangers are in a very uncomfortable position, and I wish I could help them to get back to their own country.

column2: Thank you, said Trot. We wish so, too. Haven't you any fairies here? Oh, there are fairies, of course, as there are everywhere, answered Tourmaline,
column3: Thank you, said Trot. We wish so, too. Haven't you any fairies here? Oh, there are fairies, of course, as there are everywhere, answered Tourmaline,

column2: but none that we can call to our assistance or command to do our bidding.
column3: but none that we can call to our assistance or command to do our bidding.

column2: How about witches? asked Button-Bright.
column3: How about witches? asked Button-Bright.

column2: I know of one witch, said Tourmaline thoughtfully, but she is not very obliging. She says it makes her head ache to perform witchcraft, and so she seldom indulges in it.
column3: I know of one witch, said Tourmaline thoughtfully, but she is not very obliging. She says it makes her head ache to perform witchcraft, and so she seldom indulges in it.

column2: But if there is no other way, I may be obliged to call upon Rosalie for help. I'll look in the Great Book first. Meantime, you will go home with Coralie,
column3: But if there is no other way, I may be obliged to call upon Rosalie for help. I'll look in the Great Book first. Meantime, you will go home with Coralie,

column2: who will feed you and give you entertainment.
column3: who will feed you and give you entertainment.

column3: Tomorrow morning come to me again and then I will decree your fate. The little queen then picked up her stocking and began to darn the holes in it,

column2: and Coralie, without any formal parting, led the strangers from the miserable palace.
column3: and Coralie, without any formal parting, led the strangers from the miserable palace.

column2: Sky island by L Frank Baum. Chapter 15 THE SUNRISE TRIBE AND THE SUNSET TRIBE. Although Trot and her comrades were still prisoners, they were far more comfortable than they had been in the Blue Country.
column3: Sky island by L Frank Baum. Chapter fifteen THE SUNRISE TRIBE AND THE SUNSET TRIBE. Although Trot and her comrades were still prisoners, they were far more comfortable than they had been in the Blue Country.

column2: Coralie took them to her own home, where she lived in great luxury, being one of the prominent women of the Pinkies. In this country the women seemed fully as important as the men,
column3: Coralie took them to her own home, where she lived in great luxury, being one of the prominent women of the Pinkies. In this country the women seemed fully as important as the men,

column2: and instead of being coddled and petted, they performed their share of the work, both in public and private affairs, and were expected to fight in the wars exactly as the men did.
column3: and instead of being coddled and petted, they performed their share of the work, both in public and private affairs, and were expected to fight in the wars exactly as the men did.

column2: Our friends learned considerable about the Pinkies during that afternoon and evening, for their hostess proved kind and agreeable and frankly answered all their questions.
column3: Our friends learned considerable about the Pinkies during that afternoon and evening, for their hostess proved kind and agreeable and frankly answered all their questions.

column2: Although this half of Sky Island was no larger than the Blue Country, being no more than two miles square, it had several hundred inhabitants.
column3: Although this half of Sky Island was no larger than the Blue Country, being no more than two miles square, it had several hundred inhabitants.

column2: These were divided into two tribes, which were called the Sunrise Tribe and the Sunset Tribe. The Sunrise Tribe lived in the eastern half of the Pink Country and the Sunset Tribe in the west half,
column3: These were divided into two tribes, which were called the Sunrise Tribe and the Sunset Tribe. The Sunrise Tribe lived in the eastern half of the Pink Country and the Sunset Tribe in the west half,

column2: and there was great rivalry between them, and sometimes war.
column3: and there was great rivalry between them, and sometimes war.

column2: It was all a question of social importance. The Sunrise Tribe claimed that every day the sun greeted them first of all, which proved they were the most important;
column3: It was all a question of social importance. The Sunrise Tribe claimed that every day the sun greeted them first of all, which proved they were the most important;

column2: but on the other hand, the Sunset Tribe claimed that the sun always deserted the other tribe and came to them, which was evidence that they were the most attractive people.
column3: but on the other hand, the Sunset Tribe claimed that the sun always deserted the other tribe and came to them, which was evidence that they were the most attractive people.

column2: On Sky Island at least on the Pink side the sun arose in wonderful splendor, but also it set in a blaze of glory, and so there were arguments on both sides,
column3: On Sky Island at least on the Pink side the sun arose in wonderful splendor, but also it set in a blaze of glory, and so there were arguments on both sides,

column2: and for want of something better to argue about, the Pinkies took this queer subject as a cause of dispute.
column3: and for want of something better to argue about, the Pinkies took this queer subject as a cause of dispute.

column2: Both Tribes acknowledged Tourmaline their Queen and obeyed the laws of the country, and just at this time there was peace in the land, and all the inhabitants of the east and west were friendly.
column3: Both Tribes acknowledged Tourmaline their Queen and obeyed the laws of the country, and just at this time there was peace in the land, and all the inhabitants of the east and west were friendly.

column2: But they had been known, Coralie said, to fight one another fiercely with their sharp sticks, at which times a good many were sure to get hurt.
column3: But they had been known, Coralie said, to fight one another fiercely with their sharp sticks, at which times a good many were sure to get hurt.

column2: Why do they call this an Island? asked Button-Bright. There isn't any water around it, is there? No, but there is sky all around it, answered Coralie.
column3: Why do they call this an Island? asked Button-Bright. There isn't any water around it, is there? No, but there is sky all around it, answered Coralie.

column2: And if one should step off the edge, he would go tumbling into the great sky and never be heard of again. Is there a fence around the edge? asked Trot.
column3: And if one should step off the edge, he would go tumbling into the great sky and never be heard of again. Is there a fence around the edge? asked Trot.

column2: Only a few places are fenced, was the reply. Usually there are rows of thick bushes set close to the edge to prevent people from falling off.
column3: Only a few places are fenced, was the reply. Usually there are rows of thick bushes set close to the edge to prevent people from falling off.

column2: Once there was a King of the Pinkies who was cruel and overbearing and imagined he was superior to the people he ruled, so one day his subjects carried him to the edge of the island and threw him over the bushes.
column3: Once there was a King of the Pinkies who was cruel and overbearing and imagined he was superior to the people he ruled, so one day his subjects carried him to the edge of the island and threw him over the bushes.

column2: Goodness me! said Trot. He might have hit someone on the Earth. Guess he skipped it, though, added captain Bill, for I never heard of a Pinky till I came here.
column3: Goodness me! said Trot. He might have hit someone on the Earth. Guess he skipped it, though, added captain Bill, for I never heard of a Pinky till I came here.

column2: And I have never heard of the Earth, retorted Coralie. Of course, there must be such a place, because you came from there, but the Earth is never visible in our sky.
column3: And I have never heard of the Earth, retorted Coralie. Of course, there must be such a place, because you came from there, but the Earth is never visible in our sky.

column2: No, said Button-Bright, because it's UNDER your island. But it's there, all right, and it's a pretty good place to live. I wish I could get back to it.
column3: No, said Button-Bright, because it's UNDER your island. But it's there, all right, and it's a pretty good place to live. I wish I could get back to it.

column2: So do I, Button-Bright! exclaimed Trot.
column3: So do I, Button-Bright! exclaimed Trot.

column2: Let's fly! cried the parrot, turning his head so that one bright little eye looked directly into the girl's eye. Say goodbye and let's fly through the sky, far and high!
column3: Let's fly! cried the parrot, turning his head so that one bright little eye looked directly into the girl's eye. Say goodbye and let's fly through the sky, far and high!

column2: If we only had my umbrella, we'd fly in a minute, sighed Button-Bright.
column3: If we only had my umbrella, we'd fly in a minute, sighed Button-Bright.

column2: But the Boolooroo stole it. Naughty, naughty Boolooroo, What a wicked thing to do! wailed the parrot, and they all agreed with him.
column3: But the Boolooroo stole it. Naughty, naughty Boolooroo, What a wicked thing to do! wailed the parrot, and they all agreed with him.

column2: Coralie belonged to the Sunset Tribe, as she lived west of the queen's palace, which was the center of the Pink Country. A servant came to the room where they were conversing to state that the sun was about to set,
column3: Coralie belonged to the Sunset Tribe, as she lived west of the queen's palace, which was the center of the Pink Country. A servant came to the room where they were conversing to state that the sun was about to set,

column2: and at once Coralie arose and took the strangers to an upper balcony, where all the household had assembled.
column3: and at once Coralie arose and took the strangers to an upper balcony, where all the household had assembled.

column2: The neighboring houses also had their balconies and roofs filled with people, for it seemed all the Sunset Tribe came out every night to witness the setting of the sun.
column3: The neighboring houses also had their balconies and roofs filled with people, for it seemed all the Sunset Tribe came out every night to witness the setting of the sun.

column2: It was really a magnificent sight, and Trot scarcely breathed as the great, golden ball sank low in the sky and colored all the clouds with gorgeous tints of orange, red and yellow.
column3: It was really a magnificent sight, and Trot scarcely breathed as the great, golden ball sank low in the sky and colored all the clouds with gorgeous tints of orange, red and yellow.

column2: Never on the Earth was there visible such splendor, and as the little girl watched the ever-changing scene, she decided the Sunset Tribe was amply justified in claiming that the West was the favored country of the sun.
column3: Never on the Earth was there visible such splendor, and as the little girl watched the ever-changing scene, she decided the Sunset Tribe was amply justified in claiming that the West was the favored country of the sun.

column2: You see, said captain Bill, the sky is all around us, and we're high up, so the sun really loses itself in the clouds and leaves a trail of beauty behind him.
column3: You see, said captain Bill, the sky is all around us, and we're high up, so the sun really loses itself in the clouds and leaves a trail of beauty behind him.

column2: He does that! agreed Trot. This is almost worth comin' for, captain. But not quite, said Button-bright sadly. I'd get along without the sunset if only we could go home.
column3: He does that! agreed Trot. This is almost worth comin' for, captain. But not quite, said Button-bright sadly. I'd get along without the sunset if only we could go home.

column2: They went in to dinner after this, and sat at Coralie's own table with her husband and children and found the meal very good.
column3: They went in to dinner after this, and sat at Coralie's own table with her husband and children and found the meal very good.

column2: After a pleasant evening, during which no reference was made to their being prisoners, they were shown to prettily furnished rooms all in pink and slept soundly in the soft beds provided for them.
column3: After a pleasant evening, during which no reference was made to their being prisoners, they were shown to prettily furnished rooms all in pink and slept soundly in the soft beds provided for them.

column2: Trot wakened early the next morning and went out on the balcony to see the sunrise. The little girl was well repaid, for the splendor of the rising sun was almost equal to that of the setting sun.
column3: Trot wakened early the next morning and went out on the balcony to see the sunrise. The little girl was well repaid, for the splendor of the rising sun was almost equal to that of the setting sun.

column2: Surely this was a wonderful country and much more delightful than the Blue side of the island, where the sun was hidden by the great Fog and only the moon was visible.
column3: Surely this was a wonderful country and much more delightful than the Blue side of the island, where the sun was hidden by the great Fog and only the moon was visible.

column2: When she went in, she found that both Button-Bright and captain Bill were up and dressed, so they decided to take a walk before breakfast.
column3: When she went in, she found that both Button-Bright and captain Bill were up and dressed, so they decided to take a walk before breakfast.

column2: No one restrained them or interfered with them in any way. They know we can't get away, observed the sailor, so they don't need to watch us.
column3: No one restrained them or interfered with them in any way. They know we can't get away, observed the sailor, so they don't need to watch us.

column2: We could go into the Fog Bank again, suggested Trot.
column3: We could go into the Fog Bank again, suggested Trot.

column2: We could, mate, but we won't, answered captain Bill. If there's no way for us to get clean off'n Sky Island, I'd rather stay with the Pinkies than with the Blues.
column3: We could, mate, but we won't, answered captain Bill. If there's no way for us to get clean off'n Sky Island, I'd rather stay with the Pinkies than with the Blues.

column2: I wonder what they'll do with us, said Button-Bright. The Queen seems like a nice girl, and I don't think she'll hurt us, whatever happens.
column3: I wonder what they'll do with us, said Button-Bright. The Queen seems like a nice girl, and I don't think she'll hurt us, whatever happens.

column2: They walked freely along the circular street, seeing such sights as the Pink City afforded, and then returned to Coralie's house for breakfast.
column3: They walked freely along the circular street, seeing such sights as the Pink City afforded, and then returned to Coralie's house for breakfast.

column2: Coralie herself was not there, as she had been summoned to the Queen's palace, but her husband looked after the guests, and when breakfast was finished he said to them,
column3: Coralie herself was not there, as she had been summoned to the Queen's palace, but her husband looked after the guests, and when breakfast was finished he said to them,

column2: I am to take you to Tourmaline, who has promised to decide your fate this morning.
column3: I am to take you to Tourmaline, who has promised to decide your fate this morning.

column2: I am curious to know what she will do with you, for in all our history we have never before had strangers intrude upon us.
column3: I am curious to know what she will do with you, for in all our history we have never before had strangers intrude upon us.

column2: We're curious, too, said Trot, but we'll soon find out. As they walked down the street, they observed that the sky was now covered with dark clouds which entirely hid the sun.
column3: We're curious, too, said Trot, but we'll soon find out. As they walked down the street, they observed that the sky was now covered with dark clouds which entirely hid the sun.

column2: Does it ever rain here? inquired Button-Bright.
column3: Does it ever rain here? inquired Button-Bright.

column2: Certainly, answered Coralie's husband, that is the one drawback of our country: it rains quite often. And although it makes the flowers and the grass grow,
column3: Certainly, answered Coralie's husband, that is the one drawback of our country: it rains quite often. And although it makes the flowers and the grass grow,

column2: I think rain is very disagreeable.
column3: I think rain is very disagreeable.

column2: I am always glad to see the rainbow, which is a sign that the sun will shine again. Looks like rain now, remarked captain Bill.
column3: I am always glad to see the rainbow, which is a sign that the sun will shine again. Looks like rain now, remarked captain Bill.

column2: It does, said the man, glancing at the sky. We must hurry, or we may get wet. Haven't you any umbrellas? asked Button-Bright.
column3: It does, said the man, glancing at the sky. We must hurry, or we may get wet. Haven't you any umbrellas? asked Button-Bright.

column2: No, we don't know what umbrellas are, replied the Pinky man.
column3: No, we don't know what umbrellas are, replied the Pinky man.

column2: It did not rain at once, and they reached Tourmaline's wretched hut in safety. There they found quite a number of Pinkies assembled, and a spirited discussion was taking place when they arrived.
column3: It did not rain at once, and they reached Tourmaline's wretched hut in safety. There they found quite a number of Pinkies assembled, and a spirited discussion was taking place when they arrived.

column2: Come in, please, said Tourmaline, opening the door for them, and when they had entered, she placed a pinkwood bench for them to sit upon and went back to her throne,
column3: Come in, please, said Tourmaline, opening the door for them, and when they had entered, she placed a pinkwood bench for them to sit upon and went back to her throne,

column2: which was a common rocking chair.
column3: which was a common rocking chair.

column2: At her right were seated six men and women of the Sunrise Tribe, and on her left six men and women of the Sunset Tribe, among the latter being Coralie.
column3: At her right were seated six men and women of the Sunrise Tribe, and on her left six men and women of the Sunset Tribe, among the latter being Coralie.

column2: The contrast between the plain, simple dress of the Queen and the gorgeous apparel of her Counselors was quite remarkable, yet her beauty far surpassed that of any of her people,

column2: When the strangers were seated, she turned to them and said, I have searched through the Great Book of Laws and found nothing about foreign people entering our land.
column3: When the strangers were seated, she turned to them and said, I have searched through the Great Book of Laws and found nothing about foreign people entering our land.

column2: There is a law that if any of the Blueskins break through the Fog Bank, they shall be driven back with sharp sticks; but you are not Blueskins, so this Law does not apply to you.

column2: Therefore, in order to decide your fate, I have summoned a Council of twelve of my people, who will vote as to whether you shall be permitted to remain here or not.

column2: It rained all the way and the walking was very disagreeable, but our friends were confronting an important crisis in their strange adventures,
column3: It rained all the way and the walking was very disagreeable, but our friends were confronting an important crisis in their strange adventures,

column2: and with possible death at their journey's end, they were in no hurry to arrive there.
column3: and with possible death at their journey's end, they were in no hurry to arrive there.

column2: Once free of the City they traversed the open country, and here they often stepped into sticky, pink mud up to their ankles.
column3: Once free of the City they traversed the open country, and here they often stepped into sticky, pink mud up to their ankles.

column2: captain Bill's wooden leg would often go down deep and stick fast in this mud, and at such times he would be helpless until two of the Pinkies who were a strong people pulled him out again.
column3: captain Bill's wooden leg would often go down deep and stick fast in this mud, and at such times he would be helpless until two of the Pinkies who were a strong people pulled him out again.

column2: The parrot was getting its feathers sadly draggled in the rain, and the poor bird soon presented a wet and woebegone appearance.
column3: The parrot was getting its feathers sadly draggled in the rain, and the poor bird soon presented a wet and woebegone appearance.

column2: Soak us again, Drown us with rain! it muttered in a resigned tone; and then it would turn to Trot and moan, The rose is red, the violet's blue, The Pinkies are a beastly crew!
column3: Soak us again, Drown us with rain! it muttered in a resigned tone; and then it would turn to Trot and moan, The rose is red, the violet's blue, The Pinkies are a beastly crew!

column2: The country was not so trim and neatly kept near the edge, for it was evident the people did not care to go too near to the dangerous place.
column3: The country was not so trim and neatly kept near the edge, for it was evident the people did not care to go too near to the dangerous place.

column2: There was a row of thick bushes which concealed the gulf below, and as they approached these bushes the rain abruptly ceased, and the clouds began to break and drift away in the sky.
column3: There was a row of thick bushes which concealed the gulf below, and as they approached these bushes the rain abruptly ceased, and the clouds began to break and drift away in the sky.

column2: Two of you seize the girl and throw her over, said Tourmaline in a calm, matter-of-fact way, and two others must throw the boy over.
column3: Two of you seize the girl and throw her over, said Tourmaline in a calm, matter-of-fact way, and two others must throw the boy over.

column2: It may take four, perhaps, to lift the huge and ancient man. More'n that, said captain Bill grimly. I'm pretty sure it'll take all of you, young lady,
column3: It may take four, perhaps, to lift the huge and ancient man. More'n that, said captain Bill grimly. I'm pretty sure it'll take all of you, young lady,

column2: and the chances are you won't do it then.
column3: and the chances are you won't do it then.

column2: They had halted a short distance from the bushes, and now there suddenly appeared through a rift in the clouds an immense Rainbow.
column3: They had halted a short distance from the bushes, and now there suddenly appeared through a rift in the clouds an immense Rainbow.

column2: It was perfectly formed and glistened with a dozen or more superb tintings that were so vivid and brilliant and blended into one another so exquisitely that everyone paused to gaze enraptured upon the sight.
column3: It was perfectly formed and glistened with a dozen or more superb tintings that were so vivid and brilliant and blended into one another so exquisitely that everyone paused to gaze enraptured upon the sight.

column2: Steadily, yet with wonderful swiftness, the end of the great bow descended until it rested upon the pink field almost at the feet of the little party of observers.
column3: Steadily, yet with wonderful swiftness, the end of the great bow descended until it rested upon the pink field almost at the feet of the little party of observers.

column2: Then they saw, dancing gaily upon the arch, a score of beautiful maidens, dressed in fleecy robes of rainbow tints which fluttered around them like clouds.
column3: Then they saw, dancing gaily upon the arch, a score of beautiful maidens, dressed in fleecy robes of rainbow tints which fluttered around them like clouds.

column2: The Daughters of the Rainbow! whispered Tourmaline in an awed voice, and the Witch beside her nodded and said, Fairies of the sky.
column3: The Daughters of the Rainbow! whispered Tourmaline in an awed voice, and the Witch beside her nodded and said, Fairies of the sky.

column2: What did I tell you, Tourmaline? Just then one of the maidens tripped lightly down the span of the arch until near the very end, leaning over to observe the group below.
column3: What did I tell you, Tourmaline? Just then one of the maidens tripped lightly down the span of the arch until near the very end, leaning over to observe the group below.

column2: She was exquisitely fair, dainty as a lily and graceful as a bough swaying in the breeze. Why, it's Polychrome! exclaimed Button-Bright in a voice of mingled wonder and delight.
column3: She was exquisitely fair, dainty as a lily and graceful as a bough swaying in the breeze. Why, it's Polychrome! exclaimed Button-Bright in a voice of mingled wonder and delight.

column2: Hello, Polly! Don't you remember me? Of course I remember Button-Bright, replied the maiden in a sweet, tinkling voice. The last time I saw you was in the Land of Oz.
column3: Hello, Polly! Don't you remember me? Of course I remember Button-Bright, replied the maiden in a sweet, tinkling voice. The last time I saw you was in the Land of Oz.

column2: Oh! cried Trot, turning to stare at the boy with big, wide-open eyes.
column3: Oh! cried Trot, turning to stare at the boy with big, wide-open eyes.

column2: Were you ever in the Land of Oz? Yes, he answered, still looking at the Rainbow's Daughter, and then he said appealingly, These people want to kill us, Polly.
column3: Were you ever in the Land of Oz? Yes, he answered, still looking at the Rainbow's Daughter, and then he said appealingly, These people want to kill us, Polly.

column2: Can't you help us? Polly wants a cracker!
column3: Can't you help us? Polly wants a cracker!

column2: Polly wants a cracker! screeched the parrot.
column3: Polly wants a cracker! screeched the parrot.

column2: Polychrome straightened up and glanced at her sisters. Tell Father to call for me in an hour or two, said she. There is work for me to do here,
column3: Polychrome straightened up and glanced at her sisters. Tell Father to call for me in an hour or two, said she. There is work for me to do here,

column2: for one of my old friends is in trouble.
column3: for one of my old friends is in trouble.

column2: With this she sprang lightly from the rainbow and stood beside Button-Bright and Trot, and scarcely had she left the splendid arch when it lifted and rose into the sky.
column3: With this she sprang lightly from the rainbow and stood beside Button-Bright and Trot, and scarcely had she left the splendid arch when it lifted and rose into the sky.

column2: The other end had been hidden in the clouds, and now the Rainbow began to fade gradually, like mist,
column3: The other end had been hidden in the clouds, and now the Rainbow began to fade gradually, like mist,

column2: and the sun broke through the clouds and shot its cheering rays over the Pink Country until presently the Rainbow had vanished altogether
column3: and the sun broke through the clouds and shot its cheering rays over the Pink Country until presently the Rainbow had vanished altogether

column2: and the only reminder of it was the lovely Polychrome standing among the wondering band of Pinkies. Tell me, she said gently to the boy, why are you here,
column3: and the only reminder of it was the lovely Polychrome standing among the wondering band of Pinkies. Tell me, she said gently to the boy, why are you here,

column2: and why do these people of the sky wish to destroy you? In a few hurried words Button-Bright related their adventures with the Magic Umbrella
column3: and why do these people of the sky wish to destroy you? In a few hurried words Button-Bright related their adventures with the Magic Umbrella

column2: and how the Boolooroo had stolen it and they had been obliged to escape into the Pink Country. Polychrome listened and then turned to the Queen.
column3: and how the Boolooroo had stolen it and they had been obliged to escape into the Pink Country. Polychrome listened and then turned to the Queen.

column2: Why have you decreed death to these innocent strangers? she asked.
column3: Why have you decreed death to these innocent strangers? she asked.

column2: They do not harmonize with our color scheme, replied Tourmaline.
column3: They do not harmonize with our color scheme, replied Tourmaline.

column2: That is utter nonsense, declared Polychrome impatiently. You're so dreadfully pink here that your color, which in itself is beautiful, had become tame and insipid.
column3: That is utter nonsense, declared Polychrome impatiently. You're so dreadfully pink here that your color, which in itself is beautiful, had become tame and insipid.

column2: What you really need is some sharp contrast to enhance the charm of your country, and to keep these three people here would be a benefit rather than an injury to you.
column3: What you really need is some sharp contrast to enhance the charm of your country, and to keep these three people here would be a benefit rather than an injury to you.

column2: At this, the Pinkies looked downcast and ashamed, while only Rosalie the Witch laughed and seemed to enjoy the rebuke. But, protested Tourmaline,
column3: At this, the Pinkies looked downcast and ashamed, while only Rosalie the Witch laughed and seemed to enjoy the rebuke. But, protested Tourmaline,

column2: the Great Book of Laws says our country shall harbor none but the Pinkies.
column3: the Great Book of Laws says our country shall harbor none but the Pinkies.

column2: Does it indeed? asked the Rainbow's Daughter. Come, let us return at once to your City and examine your Book of Laws. I am quite sure I can find in them absolute protection for these poor wanderers.
column3: Does it indeed? asked the Rainbow's Daughter. Come, let us return at once to your City and examine your Book of Laws. I am quite sure I can find in them absolute protection for these poor wanderers.

column2: They dared not disobey Polychrome's request, so at once they all turned and walked back to the City. As it was still muddy underfoot, the Rainbow's Daughter took a cloak from one of the women,
column3: They dared not disobey Polychrome's request, so at once they all turned and walked back to the City. As it was still muddy underfoot, the Rainbow's Daughter took a cloak from one of the women,

column2: partly rolled it, and threw it upon the ground.
column3: partly rolled it, and threw it upon the ground.

column2: Then she stepped upon it and began walking forward. The cloak unrolled as she advanced, affording a constant carpet for her feet and for those of the others who followed her.
column3: Then she stepped upon it and began walking forward. The cloak unrolled as she advanced, affording a constant carpet for her feet and for those of the others who followed her.

column2: So, being protected from the mud and wet, they speedily gained the City and in a short time were all gathered in the low room of Tourmaline's palace,
column3: So, being protected from the mud and wet, they speedily gained the City and in a short time were all gathered in the low room of Tourmaline's palace,

column2: where the Great Book of Laws lay upon a table.
column3: where the Great Book of Laws lay upon a table.

column2: Polychrome began turning over the leaves, while the others all watched her anxiously and in silence. Here, she said presently, is a Law which reads as follows:
column3: Polychrome began turning over the leaves, while the others all watched her anxiously and in silence. Here, she said presently, is a Law which reads as follows:

column2: 'Everyone in the Pink Country is entitled to the protection of the Ruler and to a house and a good living, except only the Blueskins.
column3: 'Everyone in the Pink Country is entitled to the protection of the Ruler and to a house and a good living, except only the Blueskins.

column2: If any of the natives of the Blue Country should ever break through the Fog Bank, they must be driven back with sharp sticks.
column3: If any of the natives of the Blue Country should ever break through the Fog Bank, they must be driven back with sharp sticks.

column2: ' Have you read this Law, Tourmaline? Yes, said the Queen, but how does that apply to these strangers? Why, being in the Pink Country, as they surely are,
column3: ' Have you read this Law, Tourmaline? Yes, said the Queen, but how does that apply to these strangers? Why, being in the Pink Country, as they surely are,

column2: and not being Blueskins, they are by this Law entitled to protection, to a home and good living.
column3: and not being Blueskins, they are by this Law entitled to protection, to a home and good living.

column2: The Law does not say 'Pinkies,' it says any who are in the Pink Country. True, agreed Coralie, greatly pleased, and all the other Pinkies nodded their heads and repeated, True, true!
column3: The Law does not say 'Pinkies,' it says any who are in the Pink Country. True, agreed Coralie, greatly pleased, and all the other Pinkies nodded their heads and repeated, True, true!

column2: The rose is red, the violet's blue, The law's the thing, because it's true! cried the parrot.
column3: The rose is red, the violet's blue, The law's the thing, because it's true! cried the parrot.

column2: I am indeed relieved to have you interpret the Law in this way, declared Tourmaline. I knew it was cruel to throw these poor people over the edge,
column3: I am indeed relieved to have you interpret the Law in this way, declared Tourmaline. I knew it was cruel to throw these poor people over the edge,

column2: but that seemed to us the only thing to be done.
column3: but that seemed to us the only thing to be done.

column2: It was cruel and unjust, answered Polychrome as sternly as her sweet voice could speak. But here, she added, for she had still continued to turn the leaves of the Great Book,
column3: It was cruel and unjust, answered Polychrome as sternly as her sweet voice could speak. But here, she added, for she had still continued to turn the leaves of the Great Book,

column2: is another Law which you have also overlooked.
column3: is another Law which you have also overlooked.

column2: It says, 'The person, whether man or woman, boy or girl, living in the Pink Country who has the lightest skin shall be the Ruler King or Queen as long as he or she lives,
column3: It says, 'The person, whether man or woman, boy or girl, living in the Pink Country who has the lightest skin shall be the Ruler King or Queen as long as he or she lives,

column2: unless someone of a lighter skin is found, and this Ruler's commands all the people must obey.
column3: unless someone of a lighter skin is found, and this Ruler's commands all the people must obey.

column2: ' Do you know this Law? Oh yes, replied Tourmaline. That is why I am the Queen. You will notice my complexion is of a lighter pink than that of any other of my people.
column3: ' Do you know this Law? Oh yes, replied Tourmaline. That is why I am the Queen. You will notice my complexion is of a lighter pink than that of any other of my people.

column2: Yes, remarked Polychrome, looking at her critically, when you were made Queen without doubt you had the lightest-colored skin in all the Pink Country.
column3: Yes, remarked Polychrome, looking at her critically, when you were made Queen without doubt you had the lightest-colored skin in all the Pink Country.

column2: But now you are no longer Queen of the Pinkies, Tourmaline. Those assembled were so startled by this statement that they gazed at the Rainbow's Daughter in astonishment for a time.
column3: But now you are no longer Queen of the Pinkies, Tourmaline. Those assembled were so startled by this statement that they gazed at the Rainbow's Daughter in astonishment for a time.

column2: Then Tourmaline asked, Why not, your Highness? Because here is one lighter in color than yourself, pointed to Trot.
column3: Then Tourmaline asked, Why not, your Highness? Because here is one lighter in color than yourself, pointed to Trot.

column2: This girl is, by the Law of the Great Book, the rightful Queen of the Pinkies, and as loyal citizens you are all obliged to obey her commands.
column3: This girl is, by the Law of the Great Book, the rightful Queen of the Pinkies, and as loyal citizens you are all obliged to obey her commands.

column2: Give me that circlet from your brow, Tourmaline. Without hesitation Tourmaline removed the rose-gold circlet with its glittering jewel and handed it to Polychrome,
column3: Give me that circlet from your brow, Tourmaline. Without hesitation Tourmaline removed the rose-gold circlet with its glittering jewel and handed it to Polychrome,

column2: who turned and placed it upon Trot's brow.
column3: who turned and placed it upon Trot's brow.

column2: Then she called in a loud, imperative voice, Greet your new Queen, Pinkies! One by one they all advanced, knelt before Trot and pressed her hand to their lips.
column3: Then she called in a loud, imperative voice, Greet your new Queen, Pinkies! One by one they all advanced, knelt before Trot and pressed her hand to their lips.

column2: Long live Queen Mayre! called out captain Bill, dancing around on his wooden leg in great delight. Vive la Vive la ah, ah, Trot! Thank you, Polly, said Button-Bright gratefully.
column3: Long live Queen Mayre! called out captain Bill, dancing around on his wooden leg in great delight. Vive la Vive la ah, ah, Trot! Thank you, Polly, said Button-Bright gratefully.

column2: This will fix us all right, I'm sure. Why, I have done nothing, returned Polychrome, smiling upon him. It is the Law of the Country.
column3: This will fix us all right, I'm sure. Why, I have done nothing, returned Polychrome, smiling upon him. It is the Law of the Country.

column2: Isn't it surprising how little people know of their Laws? Are you all contented, Pinkies? she asked, turning to the people.
column3: Isn't it surprising how little people know of their Laws? Are you all contented, Pinkies? she asked, turning to the people.

column2: We are! they cried. Then several of the men ran out to spread the news throughout the City and Country, so that a vast crowd soon began to gather in the Court of the Statues.
column3: We are! they cried. Then several of the men ran out to spread the news throughout the City and Country, so that a vast crowd soon began to gather in the Court of the Statues.
