column2: Sky island by L Frank Baum. Chapter 18 MAYRE, QUEEN OF THE PINK COUNTRY. Polychrome now dismissed all but Button-Bright, captain Bill, Rosalie the Witch and the new Queen of the Pinkies.
column3: Sky island by L Frank Baum. Chapter eighteen MAYRE, QUEEN OF THE PINK COUNTRY. Polychrome now dismissed all but Button-Bright, captain Bill, Rosalie the Witch and the new Queen of the Pinkies.

column2: Tourmaline hastened away to her father's house to put on a beautiful gown all covered with flounces and ribbons,
column3: Tourmaline hastened away to her father's house to put on a beautiful gown all covered with flounces and ribbons,

column2: for she was glad to be relieved of the duties of the Queen and was eager to be gaily dressed and one of the people again.
column3: for she was glad to be relieved of the duties of the Queen and was eager to be gaily dressed and one of the people again.

column2: I s'pose, said Trot, I'll have to put on one of Tourmaline's common pink dresses. Yes, replied Polychrome, you must follow the customs of the country, absurd though they may be.
column3: I s'pose, said Trot, I'll have to put on one of Tourmaline's common pink dresses. Yes, replied Polychrome, you must follow the customs of the country, absurd though they may be.

column2: In the little sleeping chamber adjoining this room you will find plenty of gowns poor enough for the Queen to wear. Shall I assist you to put one on?
column3: In the little sleeping chamber adjoining this room you will find plenty of gowns poor enough for the Queen to wear. Shall I assist you to put one on?

column2: No, answered Trot, I guess I can manage it alone.
column3: No, answered Trot, I guess I can manage it alone.

column2: When she withdrew to the little chamber, the Rainbow's Daughter began conversing with the Witch, whom she urged to stay with the new queen and protect her as long as she ruled the Pink Country.
column3: When she withdrew to the little chamber, the Rainbow's Daughter began conversing with the Witch, whom she urged to stay with the new queen and protect her as long as she ruled the Pink Country.

column2: Rosalie, who longed to please the powerful Polychrome, whose fairy powers as Daughters of the Rainbow were far superior to her own witchcraft,
column3: Rosalie, who longed to please the powerful Polychrome, whose fairy powers as Daughters of the Rainbow were far superior to her own witchcraft,

column2: promised faithfully to devote herself to Queen Mayre as long as she might need her services.
column3: promised faithfully to devote herself to Queen Mayre as long as she might need her services.

column2: By the time Trot was dressed in pink and had returned to the room, there was an excited and clamorous crowd assembled in the court, and Polychrome took the little girl's hand and led her out to greet her new subjects.
column3: By the time Trot was dressed in pink and had returned to the room, there was an excited and clamorous crowd assembled in the court, and Polychrome took the little girl's hand and led her out to greet her new subjects.

column2: The Pinkies were much impressed by the fact that the Rainbow's Daughter was their new Queen's friend, and that Rosalie the Witch stood on Trot's left hand and treated her with humble deference.
column3: The Pinkies were much impressed by the fact that the Rainbow's Daughter was their new Queen's friend, and that Rosalie the Witch stood on Trot's left hand and treated her with humble deference.

column2: So they shouted their approval very enthusiastically and pressed forward one by one to kneel before their new Ruler and kiss her hand.
column3: So they shouted their approval very enthusiastically and pressed forward one by one to kneel before their new Ruler and kiss her hand.

column2: The parrot was now on captain Bill's shoulder, for Trot thought a Queen ought not to carry a bird around, but the parrot did not mind the change and was as much excited as anyone in the crowd.
column3: The parrot was now on captain Bill's shoulder, for Trot thought a Queen ought not to carry a bird around, but the parrot did not mind the change and was as much excited as anyone in the crowd.

column2: Oh, what bliss to kiss a miss! he shouted as Trot held out her hand to be kissed by her subjects, and then he would scream, We're in the sky and flyin' high;
column3: Oh, what bliss to kiss a miss! he shouted as Trot held out her hand to be kissed by her subjects, and then he would scream, We're in the sky and flyin' high;

column2: We're goin' to live instead of die, It's time to laugh instead of cry; Oh, my!
column3: We're goin' to live instead of die, It's time to laugh instead of cry; Oh, my!

column2: Ki-yi! Ain't this a pie? captain Bill let the bird jabber as he pleased, for the occasion was a joyful one, and it was no wonder the parrot was excited.
column3: Ki-yi! Ain't this a pie? captain Bill let the bird jabber as he pleased, for the occasion was a joyful one, and it was no wonder the parrot was excited.

column2: And while the throng shouted greetings to the Queen, suddenly the great Rainbow appeared in the sky and dropped its end right on the Court of the Statues.
column3: And while the throng shouted greetings to the Queen, suddenly the great Rainbow appeared in the sky and dropped its end right on the Court of the Statues.

column2: Polychrome stooped to kiss Trot and Button-Bright, gave captain Bill a charming smile and Rosalie the Witch a friendly nod of farewell.
column3: Polychrome stooped to kiss Trot and Button-Bright, gave captain Bill a charming smile and Rosalie the Witch a friendly nod of farewell.

column2: Then she sprang lightly upon the arch of the Rainbow and was greeted by the bevy of dancing, laughing maidens who were her sisters.
column3: Then she sprang lightly upon the arch of the Rainbow and was greeted by the bevy of dancing, laughing maidens who were her sisters.

column2: I shall keep watch over you, Button-Bright, she called to the boy. Don't despair, whatever happens, for behind the clouds is always the Rainbow!
column3: I shall keep watch over you, Button-Bright, she called to the boy. Don't despair, whatever happens, for behind the clouds is always the Rainbow!

column2: Thank you, Polly, he answered, and Trot also thanked the lovely Polychrome, and so did captain Bill.
column3: Thank you, Polly, he answered, and Trot also thanked the lovely Polychrome, and so did captain Bill.

column2: The parrot made quite a long speech, flying high above the arch where Polychrome stood and then back to captain Bill's shoulder.
column3: The parrot made quite a long speech, flying high above the arch where Polychrome stood and then back to captain Bill's shoulder.

column2: Said he, We Pollys know our business, and we're all right!
column3: Said he, We Pollys know our business, and we're all right!

column2: We'll take good care of captain Bill and Trot and Button-Bright.
column3: We'll take good care of captain Bill and Trot and Button-Bright.

column2: You watch 'em from the Rainbow, and I'll watch day and night, And we'll call a sky policeman if trouble comes in sight! Suddenly, the bow lifted and carried the dancing maidens into the sky.
column3: You watch 'em from the Rainbow, and I'll watch day and night, And we'll call a sky policeman if trouble comes in sight! Suddenly, the bow lifted and carried the dancing maidens into the sky.

column2: The colors faded, the arch slowly dissolved and the heavens were clear.
column3: The colors faded, the arch slowly dissolved and the heavens were clear.

column2: Trot turned to the Pinkies. Let's have a holiday today, she said.
column3: Trot turned to the Pinkies. Let's have a holiday today, she said.

column2: Have a good time and enjoy yourselves. I don't jus' know how I'm goin' to rule this country yet, but I'll think it over and let you know.
column3: Have a good time and enjoy yourselves. I don't jus' know how I'm goin' to rule this country yet, but I'll think it over and let you know.

column2: Then she went into the palace hut with captain Bill and Button-Bright and Rosalie the Witch, and the people went away to enjoy themselves and talk over the surprising events of the day.
column3: Then she went into the palace hut with captain Bill and Button-Bright and Rosalie the Witch, and the people went away to enjoy themselves and talk over the surprising events of the day.

column2: Dear me, said Trot, throwing herself into a chair, wasn't that a sudden change of fortune, though? That Rainbow's Daughter is a pretty good fairy.
column3: Dear me, said Trot, throwing herself into a chair, wasn't that a sudden change of fortune, though? That Rainbow's Daughter is a pretty good fairy.

column2: I'm glad you know her, Button-Bright. I was sure something would happen to save you, remarked Rosalie, and that was why I voted to have you thrown off the edge.
column3: I'm glad you know her, Button-Bright. I was sure something would happen to save you, remarked Rosalie, and that was why I voted to have you thrown off the edge.

column2: I wanted to discover who would come to your assistance, and I found out. Now I have made a friend of Polychrome, and that will render me more powerful as a Witch,
column3: I wanted to discover who would come to your assistance, and I found out. Now I have made a friend of Polychrome, and that will render me more powerful as a Witch,

column2: for I can call upon her for assistance whenever I need her.
column3: for I can call upon her for assistance whenever I need her.

column2: But see here, said captain Bill. You can't afford to spend your time a-rulin' this tucked-up country, Trot. Why not? asked Trot, who was pleased with her new and important position.
column3: But see here, said captain Bill. You can't afford to spend your time a-rulin' this tucked-up country, Trot. Why not? asked Trot, who was pleased with her new and important position.

column2: It'd get pretty tiresome, mate, after you'd had a few quarrels with the Pinkies, for they expec' their Queen to be as poor as poverty an' never have any fun in life.
column3: It'd get pretty tiresome, mate, after you'd had a few quarrels with the Pinkies, for they expec' their Queen to be as poor as poverty an' never have any fun in life.

column2: You wouldn't like it for long, I'm sure, added Button-Bright seriously.
column3: You wouldn't like it for long, I'm sure, added Button-Bright seriously.

column2: Trot seemed thoughtful. No, I don't know's I would, she admitted.
column3: Trot seemed thoughtful. No, I don't know's I would, she admitted.

column2: But as long as we stay here, it seems a pretty good thing to be Queen.
column3: But as long as we stay here, it seems a pretty good thing to be Queen.

column2: I guess I'm a little proud of it. I wish mother could see me rulin' the Pinkies, and Papa Griffith, too. Wouldn't they open their eyes? They would,
column3: I guess I'm a little proud of it. I wish mother could see me rulin' the Pinkies, and Papa Griffith, too. Wouldn't they open their eyes? They would,

column2: mate, but they can't see you, said captain Bill.
column3: mate, but they can't see you, said captain Bill.

column2: So the question is, what's to be done? We ought to get home, observed the boy. Our folks will worry about us, and Earth's the best place to live, after all.
column3: So the question is, what's to be done? We ought to get home, observed the boy. Our folks will worry about us, and Earth's the best place to live, after all.

column2: If we could only get hold of my Magic Umbrella, we'd be all right. The rose is red, the violet's blue, But the umbrel's stolen by the Boolooroo! screamed the parrot.
column3: If we could only get hold of my Magic Umbrella, we'd be all right. The rose is red, the violet's blue, But the umbrel's stolen by the Boolooroo! screamed the parrot.

column3: But no more. The Queen can have her share of everything 'cordin' to the new law, but if she tries to get more than her share, I'll have the law say she shall be taken to the edge and pushed off.

column2: What do you think of THAT law, Rosalie? It's a good law and a just one, replied the Witch approvingly.
column3: What do you think of THAT law, Rosalie? It's a good law and a just one, replied the Witch approvingly.

column2: So Trot sent for the Royal Scribbler, who was a very fat Pinky with large, pink eyes and curly pink hair, and had him carefully write the new law into the Great Book of Laws.
column3: So Trot sent for the Royal Scribbler, who was a very fat Pinky with large, pink eyes and curly pink hair, and had him carefully write the new law into the Great Book of Laws.

column2: The Royal Scribbler wrote it very nicely in pink ink, with a big capital letter at the beginning and a fine flourish at the end.
column3: The Royal Scribbler wrote it very nicely in pink ink, with a big capital letter at the beginning and a fine flourish at the end.

column2: After Trot had signed her name to it as Queen, she called all of the important people of the land to assemble in the Court of the Statues and ordered the Royal Declaimer to read to them the new law.
column3: After Trot had signed her name to it as Queen, she called all of the important people of the land to assemble in the Court of the Statues and ordered the Royal Declaimer to read to them the new law.

column2: The Pinkies seemed to think it was a just law and much better than the old one, and Rosalie said:
column3: The Pinkies seemed to think it was a just law and much better than the old one, and Rosalie said:

column2: Now no one can object to becoming Queen, since the Ruler of the Pinkies will no longer be obliged to endure suffering and hardships.
column3: Now no one can object to becoming Queen, since the Ruler of the Pinkies will no longer be obliged to endure suffering and hardships.

column2: All right, said Trot. In that case, I'll make you the Queen, Rosalie, for you've got more sense than Tourmaline has and your powers as a witch will help you protect the people.
column3: All right, said Trot. In that case, I'll make you the Queen, Rosalie, for you've got more sense than Tourmaline has and your powers as a witch will help you protect the people.

column2: At once she made the announcement, telling the assembled Pinkies that by virtue of her high office as Queen of Sky Island she would leave Rosalie the Witch to rule over the Pink Country while she returned to the Earth with her friends.
column3: At once she made the announcement, telling the assembled Pinkies that by virtue of her high office as Queen of Sky Island she would leave Rosalie the Witch to rule over the Pink Country while she returned to the Earth with her friends.

column2: As Rosalie was greatly loved and respected, the people joyfully accepted her as their Queen,
column3: As Rosalie was greatly loved and respected, the people joyfully accepted her as their Queen,

column2: and Trot ordered them to tear down the old hut and build a new palace for Rosalie one which would be just as good as any other house in the City, but no better.
column3: and Trot ordered them to tear down the old hut and build a new palace for Rosalie one which would be just as good as any other house in the City, but no better.

column2: She further ordered a pink statue of Tourmaline to be set up in the Court, and also a pink statue of herself, so that the record of all the rulers of the Pinkies should be complete.
column3: She further ordered a pink statue of Tourmaline to be set up in the Court, and also a pink statue of herself, so that the record of all the rulers of the Pinkies should be complete.

column2: The people agreed to do all this as soon as possible, and some of the leaders whispered together and then asked Coralie to be their spokesman in replying to Queen Trot's speech.
column3: The people agreed to do all this as soon as possible, and some of the leaders whispered together and then asked Coralie to be their spokesman in replying to Queen Trot's speech.

column2: Coralie stood on a chair and made a bow, after which she thanked Trot in the name of the Pinkies for leading them safely into the Blue Country and out again,
column3: Coralie stood on a chair and made a bow, after which she thanked Trot in the name of the Pinkies for leading them safely into the Blue Country and out again,

column2: and for giving them so good a Queen as Rosalie.
column3: and for giving them so good a Queen as Rosalie.

column2: The Pinkies would be sorry to have their new friends, the Earth people, leave them, but asked the Queen of Sky Island to carry with her the royal band of pink gold which she now wore upon her brow,
column3: The Pinkies would be sorry to have their new friends, the Earth people, leave them, but asked the Queen of Sky Island to carry with her the royal band of pink gold which she now wore upon her brow,

column2: together with the glistening pink jewel set in its center.
column3: together with the glistening pink jewel set in its center.

column2: It would remind her, Coralie declared, of the Beautiful Land of Sunset and Sunrise and of the fact that the Pinkies would always be glad to welcome her back.
column3: It would remind her, Coralie declared, of the Beautiful Land of Sunset and Sunrise and of the fact that the Pinkies would always be glad to welcome her back.

column2: Trot knew she would never return to Sky Island, but she did not tell them that. She merely thanked Coralie and the Pinkies and said they might all come to the Court after dinner and see her and her comrades fly away through the sky.
column3: Trot knew she would never return to Sky Island, but she did not tell them that. She merely thanked Coralie and the Pinkies and said they might all come to the Court after dinner and see her and her comrades fly away through the sky.

column2: End of chapter 29.
column3: End of chapter twenty-nine.

column2: Sky island by L Frank Baum. Chapter 30 THE JOURNEY HOME.
column3: Sky island by L Frank Baum. Chapter thirty THE JOURNEY HOME.

column2: After the Pinkies had been dismissed, their new Queen Rosalie, by means of a clever charm, conjured up a dinner table set with very nice things to eat.
column3: After the Pinkies had been dismissed, their new Queen Rosalie, by means of a clever charm, conjured up a dinner table set with very nice things to eat.

column2: They all enjoyed a hearty meal and afterward sat and talked over their adventures.
column3: They all enjoyed a hearty meal and afterward sat and talked over their adventures.

column2: Will you take the parrot home with you, Trot? asked captain Bill.
column3: Will you take the parrot home with you, Trot? asked captain Bill.

column2: Guess not, captain, she answered. Mother wouldn't like to have him hangin' 'round and screechin' bad po'try ev'ry minute.
column3: Guess not, captain, she answered. Mother wouldn't like to have him hangin' 'round and screechin' bad po'try ev'ry minute.

column2: I'll give him to Rosalie, for I'm sure she'll take good care of him. Rosalie accepted the gift with pleasure, but the parrot looked sober for a while and then said,
column3: I'll give him to Rosalie, for I'm sure she'll take good care of him. Rosalie accepted the gift with pleasure, but the parrot looked sober for a while and then said,

column2: This looks to me like a giveaway;
column3: This looks to me like a giveaway;

column2: But here I am, and here I'll stay.
column3: But here I am, and here I'll stay.

column2: The country's pink, but we'll all be blue When Trot goes home as she says she'll do. They now packed the lunchbasket with the remains of the feast,
column3: The country's pink, but we'll all be blue When Trot goes home as she says she'll do. They now packed the lunchbasket with the remains of the feast,

column2: for they knew a long journey was before them and feared they might be hungry before they landed again.
column3: for they knew a long journey was before them and feared they might be hungry before they landed again.

column2: captain Bill straightened out the ropes and adjusted the seats, while Button-Bright examined the umbrella to see if it had been injured in any way when the elephant tramped through the Fog Bank.
column3: captain Bill straightened out the ropes and adjusted the seats, while Button-Bright examined the umbrella to see if it had been injured in any way when the elephant tramped through the Fog Bank.

column2: The boy looked into the small red eyes of the carved elephant's-head handle with some misgivings, but as seen in the strong sunshine the eyes were merely red stones,
column3: The boy looked into the small red eyes of the carved elephant's-head handle with some misgivings, but as seen in the strong sunshine the eyes were merely red stones,

column2: while the handle plainly showed the marks of the tool that had carved it.
column3: while the handle plainly showed the marks of the tool that had carved it.

column2: When all was ready, they went into the Court of the Statues, where all the Pinkies were assembled together with their Pink Band and captain Bill hooked the swinging seats onto the handle of the Magic Umbrella.
column3: When all was ready, they went into the Court of the Statues, where all the Pinkies were assembled together with their Pink Band and captain Bill hooked the swinging seats onto the handle of the Magic Umbrella.

column2: Trot kissed Rosalie and Coralie and Tourmaline goodbye and said to them:
column3: Trot kissed Rosalie and Coralie and Tourmaline goodbye and said to them:

column2: If you ever happen to come to Earth, you must be sure to visit me, and I'll try to give you a good time. But p'raps you'll stay here all your lives.
column3: If you ever happen to come to Earth, you must be sure to visit me, and I'll try to give you a good time. But p'raps you'll stay here all your lives.

column2: I think we shall, replied Rosalie, laughing, for in all Sky Island there will be no Magic Umbrella for us to fly with. And when you see Polychrome,
column3: I think we shall, replied Rosalie, laughing, for in all Sky Island there will be no Magic Umbrella for us to fly with. And when you see Polychrome,

column2: added Trot, jus' give her my love.
column3: added Trot, jus' give her my love.

column2: Then she and Button-Bright seated themselves in the double seat, which was flat upon the pink ground, and captain Bill sat before them on his own seat,
column3: Then she and Button-Bright seated themselves in the double seat, which was flat upon the pink ground, and captain Bill sat before them on his own seat,

column2: to which the lunch basket had been fastened by means of a stout cord.
column3: to which the lunch basket had been fastened by means of a stout cord.

column2: Hold fast! said the sailor man, and they all held fast to the ropes while the boy, glancing up toward the open umbrella he held, said solemnly and distinctly:
column3: Hold fast! said the sailor man, and they all held fast to the ropes while the boy, glancing up toward the open umbrella he held, said solemnly and distinctly:

column2: Take us to Trot's house on the Earth. The umbrella obeyed, at once mounting into the air. It moved slowly at first, but gradually increased its speed.
column3: Take us to Trot's house on the Earth. The umbrella obeyed, at once mounting into the air. It moved slowly at first, but gradually increased its speed.

column2: First it lifted the seat of the boy and the girl, then captain Bill's seat, and finally the lunch basket.
column3: First it lifted the seat of the boy and the girl, then captain Bill's seat, and finally the lunch basket.

column2: Fly high! Mind your eye!
column3: Fly high! Mind your eye!

column2: Don't cry! Bye-bye! shouted the parrot from the Pink Witch's shoulder.
column3: Don't cry! Bye-bye! shouted the parrot from the Pink Witch's shoulder.

column2: Trot leaned over and waved her hand.
column3: Trot leaned over and waved her hand.

column2: The Pink Band played as loud as it could in order that the travelers might hear it as long as possible and Rosalie and Coralie and Tourmaline threw kisses to their vanishing friends as long as they remained in sight.
column3: The Pink Band played as loud as it could in order that the travelers might hear it as long as possible and Rosalie and Coralie and Tourmaline threw kisses to their vanishing friends as long as they remained in sight.

column2: Seems good to be on the way home again, remarked Trot as the umbrella bumped into a big, black cloud.
column3: Seems good to be on the way home again, remarked Trot as the umbrella bumped into a big, black cloud.

column2: It reely does, mate, answered the sailorman joyously.
column3: It reely does, mate, answered the sailorman joyously.

column2: Fast through the cloud the umbrella swept, and then suddenly it sailed into a clear, blue sky, across which a great and gorgeous Rainbow spread its radiant arch.
column3: Fast through the cloud the umbrella swept, and then suddenly it sailed into a clear, blue sky, across which a great and gorgeous Rainbow spread its radiant arch.

column2: Upon the bow danced the dainty Daughters of the Rainbow, and the umbrella passed near enough to it for the passengers to observe Polychrome merrily leading her sisters,
column3: Upon the bow danced the dainty Daughters of the Rainbow, and the umbrella passed near enough to it for the passengers to observe Polychrome merrily leading her sisters,

column2: her fleecy robes waving prettily in the gentle breeze.
column3: her fleecy robes waving prettily in the gentle breeze.

column2: Goodbye, Polly! cried Button-Bright, and Trot and captain Bill both called out, Goodbye! Polychrome heard and nodded to them smilingly, never halting in her graceful dance.
column3: Goodbye, Polly! cried Button-Bright, and Trot and captain Bill both called out, Goodbye! Polychrome heard and nodded to them smilingly, never halting in her graceful dance.

column2: Then the umbrella dropped far below the arch, which presently faded from view.
column3: Then the umbrella dropped far below the arch, which presently faded from view.

column2: It was an exciting ride. Scenes presented themselves entirely different from those they had seen on their former voyage, for the sky changes continually,
column3: It was an exciting ride. Scenes presented themselves entirely different from those they had seen on their former voyage, for the sky changes continually,

column2: and the clouds of a moment ago are not the clouds of an hour ago.
column3: and the clouds of a moment ago are not the clouds of an hour ago.

column2: Once they passed between two small stars as brilliant as diamonds, and once an enormous bird whose wings spread so wide that they shadowed the sun soared directly over them and lost itself in the vague distance of the limitless sky.
column3: Once they passed between two small stars as brilliant as diamonds, and once an enormous bird whose wings spread so wide that they shadowed the sun soared directly over them and lost itself in the vague distance of the limitless sky.

column2: They rode quite comfortably, however, and were full of eager interest in what they saw.
column3: They rode quite comfortably, however, and were full of eager interest in what they saw.

column2: The rush of air past them made them hungry, so captain Bill drew up the lunchbasket and held it so that Button-Bright and Trot could help themselves to the pink food, which tasted very good.
column3: The rush of air past them made them hungry, so captain Bill drew up the lunchbasket and held it so that Button-Bright and Trot could help themselves to the pink food, which tasted very good.

column2: And finally a dark rim appeared below them, which the sailor declared must be the Earth. He proved to be correct, and when they came nearer, they found themselves flying over the waves of the ocean.
column3: And finally a dark rim appeared below them, which the sailor declared must be the Earth. He proved to be correct, and when they came nearer, they found themselves flying over the waves of the ocean.

column2: Pretty soon a small island appeared, and Trot exclaimed, That's the Sky Island we thought we were goin' to only we didn't.
column3: Pretty soon a small island appeared, and Trot exclaimed, That's the Sky Island we thought we were goin' to only we didn't.

column2: Yes, and there's the mainland, mate! cried captain Bill excitedly, pointing toward a distant coast.
column3: Yes, and there's the mainland, mate! cried captain Bill excitedly, pointing toward a distant coast.

column2: On swept the Magic Umbrella. Then its speed gradually slackened; the houses and trees on the coast could be seen,
column3: On swept the Magic Umbrella. Then its speed gradually slackened; the houses and trees on the coast could be seen,

column2: and presently almost before they realized it they were set down gently upon the high bluff near the giant acacia.
column3: and presently almost before they realized it they were set down gently upon the high bluff near the giant acacia.

column2: A little way off stood the white cottage where Trot lived.
column3: A little way off stood the white cottage where Trot lived.

column2: It was growing dusk as captain Bill unhooked the seats and Button-Bright folded up the umbrella and tucked it under his arm.
column3: It was growing dusk as captain Bill unhooked the seats and Button-Bright folded up the umbrella and tucked it under his arm.

column2: Trot seized the lunchbasket and ran to the house, where she found her mother busy in the kitchen.
column3: Trot seized the lunchbasket and ran to the house, where she found her mother busy in the kitchen.

column2: Well, I'm back again, said the little girl. Is supper ready, mama? Button-Bright stayed all night with them, but next morning, bright and early,
column3: Well, I'm back again, said the little girl. Is supper ready, mama? Button-Bright stayed all night with them, but next morning, bright and early,

column2: he hooked one of the seats to his Magic Umbrella, said goodbye to Trot and captain Bill, and flew into the air to begin his journey to Philadelphia.
column3: he hooked one of the seats to his Magic Umbrella, said goodbye to Trot and captain Bill, and flew into the air to begin his journey to Philadelphia.

column2: Just before he started, Trot said:
column3: Just before he started, Trot said:

column2: Let me know if you get home safe, Button-Bright, and come and see me again as quick as you can. I'll try to come again, said the boy.
column3: Let me know if you get home safe, Button-Bright, and come and see me again as quick as you can. I'll try to come again, said the boy.

column2: We've had a good time, haven't we, Trot? The bes' time I EVER had! she replied enthusiastically. Then she asked, Didn't you like it, too, captain Bill?
column3: We've had a good time, haven't we, Trot? The bes' time I EVER had! she replied enthusiastically. Then she asked, Didn't you like it, too, captain Bill?

column2: Parts of it, mate, the sailor answered as he thoughtfully made marks in the sand with the end of his wooden leg, but seems to me the bes' part of all was gett'n' home again.
column3: Parts of it, mate, the sailor answered as he thoughtfully made marks in the sand with the end of his wooden leg, but seems to me the bes' part of all was gett'n' home again.

column2: After several days Trot received a postal card from Button-Bright. It was awkwardly scrawled, for the boy was not much of a writer, but Trot managed to make out the words. It read as follows:
column3: After several days Trot received a postal card from Button-Bright. It was awkwardly scrawled, for the boy was not much of a writer, but Trot managed to make out the words. It read as follows:

column2: Got home safe, Trot, and the folks were so worried they forgot to scold me. Father has taken the Magic Umbrella and locked it up in the big, strong chest in the attic.
column3: Got home safe, Trot, and the folks were so worried they forgot to scold me. Father has taken the Magic Umbrella and locked it up in the big, strong chest in the attic.

column2: He put the key in his own pocket, so I don't know as I'll ever be able to see you again. But I'll never forget the Queen of Sky Island, and I send my love to you and captain Bill.
column3: He put the key in his own pocket, so I don't know as I'll ever be able to see you again. But I'll never forget the Queen of Sky Island, and I send my love to you and captain Bill.

column2: Your friend, Button-Bright.
column3: Your friend, Button-Bright.
